text: Warming up to the DBs. It more or less fits the canon descriptions, Id agree w the previous guy that its just thinner than like Andechs or my (so far unfairly downrated) Salvator. Some carbo would be nice and a tad syrupy. But all the bread is nice, slightly more caramelized than others Ive had, nuts, etc. Not bad
Bottle from Biershop Bayern. Hazy brown colour. Malty, sweetish, some banana, dark fruit .Smooth and easy drinkable, bit sweet. Not bad.
well below the top doppels imo; nice aroma; subdued - malts, toffee. taste is bland; thin; light medicinal. well below the other top doppels I have rated.
Tiefdunkel, schwarz im Glas mit sehr schwacher Krone. Röstmalziger Antrunk, Kaffeearomen gepaart mit Alknoten bis zum Abgang.
Aroma of roasted malt,caramel.taste of dark roasted bread,caramel,dark sugar.complex beer

Pours beautiful copper with a thin beige head. Clear. Aroma is malty, a bit sweet and with some dried dark fruits. Taste.. oh, it is truly satisfying. Malty, fruity and sweet and bitter. Kind of like I want all bock style beers to be. Lots of balanced caramel flavours, some candy and heaps of caramel ice-cream. With dried plums as toppings. Kind of takes me back to medieval times as for some reason this is tasting as I would imagine beer to taste during the time of knights.

Bottle. Black/brown. Beautiful head. Aroma of red berries, treacle and malts. Sweet and vinous. Taste is a little bit fruity sweet, a tad bit spicy and bitter. Caramell, plums, liquorice and malts. Heavy, complex and balanced. Good carbonation and mouthfeel. Amazing Doppelbock. Very bavarian but for whatever reason also images of Belgium and Britain cross my mind.

Bottle.

A- Musty, dusty, alcohol, raisins, rum cake, dark fruits, molasses.

A- Garnet color, clear liquid, beige head.

T- Raisins, booze, subtle iron, dark fruits, molasses.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- If all Doppelbocks were like this, Id drink more of them. Lots of nice dark flavors.
50cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Couleur acajou. Arômes de fruits mûrs. Bière très ronde et agréable.
500ml Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Malty aroma with raisins, burnt toast and brown sugar. Roasted and malty taste with treacle, raisins, wheat and blackcurrant. An interesting and complex bock.
500ml bottle from the Old Fishing Shack Pub in Paphos. Pours dark brown with a medium-sized creamy head. Aroma is malt, dark chocolate, burnt caramel. Taste is malt, dark fruits, caramel.

Bottle. Deep Reddish Brown. Smooth, sweet, rich, super-malty, fruity strong bock. Roasty/burnt malt, burnt sugar, caramel, and yet more malt!! Dark fruits. Chocolate. Warming alcohol. Long roast malt finish. Super beer! (2008)
16.9 oz bottle pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, coffee, caramel and roast. Taste is sweet caramel, toffee and plums

Bottle from Auchan. Nice dark brown color, wih thin, rapid dissipating pink-ish head. Aroma is nice: dried plums, caramel, roasted malt. Taste is a bit too sweet, and with notes of caramel, dark fruits. You can feel the alcohol. Sweet and lasting finish. A good one for its price.

I pint 0.9 oz. bottle. Pours a brownish-black with a tall, frothy, tan head that lasts forever. Smells like sweet milk-chocolate and caramel. Taste is sweet with flavors of lightly-burnt caramel and a hint of licorice and honey. It is medium-bodied with a creamy texture. Carbonation is average and the finish is long and sweet. Theres really not much I can quibble about. This is just a really great beer and will soon become one of my favorites.
Butelka 0,5l. Obfita piana, ciemny bursztyn, klarowne. W aromacie przypieczone pieczywo, ciemne słody, bardzo przyjemne. W smaku ponownie ciemne słody, skórka od chleba. Bardzo dobre.
Solid. Deep dark pour, similar to cola. chocolate and raisins on the nose, good dark fruit flavors. roasted malts, coffee...good stuff.
Bottle. Almost black color with tanned head. Aroma has caramel, dark fruits, roasted malt. Taste is malty with quite long a bit aftertaste. Flavors of malt, dark fruits, caramel. Well balanced.

22.12.2016 - Pretty dark pour with small brown head. Roasted malt, sweetness, some chocolate and alcohol in aroma and taste. 0,5 was bit too much that evening. I would prefer a 0,33l bottle. But nevertheless a nice Doppelbock

Bottle. Medium light brown head. Dark read color of body. Aroma of malt, caramel, candies and plums. In flavor also mostly caramel and malt notes with some dark fruits and licorice. Sweet. Medium-full body.. Some chocolate notes in finish. Overall: nice one. Maybe little too sweet for me, but this is bock and it is very representative.

0.5 l bottle at Sheridans Irish Pub. Very dark brown, small beige head. Caramel, cloves, roasty, dry figs. Moderate sweet, caramel and light roasty. Medium body, medium carbonation. Sweet finish, nicely lasting. Like it.

Ok the first Bock beer Iv tried and to be honest im not sure whether I found it disgusting or whether I just found it different. Looks good in the glass very dark brown almost black. Taste is hugely malty and hints of liquorice, toasted malt, barley sugar sweets, dandelion and burdock. I really wanted to like it, but struggled to be honest. Has a really thick syrupy mouth feel. I will try the style again, and may change my mind.

Bottle. Pours clear brown with average, partly lasting tan head. Aroma of ripe fruits, raisins, cherries, mixed with bock bread aroma and hints of caramel. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, malt, bread, ripe fruits. Finish is dry. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Great bock, nice combination of aromas.

Pours almost black, a very dark, yet vivid, brown color with ember hints and a foamy small head, soon vanished into a glass coating lacing.

Smells of spicy licorice, rustic bread, dried plums and bakers chocolate. This forms a very intriguing, well balanced and complex nose, relying on a rich, diverse maltiness. Honey and toasted hazelnuts, together with just a dry whiff complete the aromas in this, hinting to a well brewed, tasty beer.

Has a soft, vivid carbonation, showcasing a medium bodied beer, which puts its focus on the malts theoughout, while producing an amazing depth of flavors, soothed by a nice whipped cream fluffiness.

Tastes of milk chocolate, caramel, rustic bread crust, old pepper hulls, earth and marzipan. Awesomly complex, sweet but with an earthen balance to it, which makes it possible for the flavors to develop flawlessly, enriched by the soft carbonation, which lets the beer glide gently over the tongue. Licorice sets in after the swallow with a short Coca-Cola like sweet peak, immediately toned down by bakers chocolate, a prominent and sudden dryness and rustic bread. 
The finish provides another reference to the supersoft mouthfeel with a sparkly carbonation hint in it, gently complimenting to earth and toffee - rustic and well-rounded.

Awesome Bock - rustic, sweet, malty, earthy with an intriguing depth of flavors to it, which tend to benefit from each other the whole time. There is even a short, warming peak to be found, hinting to the bigger body of the beer and its purpose of being a very drinkable, unique winter warmer.

Dark brown color with creamy beige head. Strong and sweet malty aroma combined with bread. Taste follows the aroma : very malty, some roast, coffee and chocolate. Sweet and easy to drink. Moderate carbonation. Overall very tasty doppelbock, nice!
Mahtavaa mämmistä ja paahtunutta makua, jossa ei ole tippakaan liikaa kitkeryyttä seassa.

Bottle @ Brought by Dedollewaiter. Pours nearly opaque deep brown with an off white head. Aroma of caramel, chewy caramel, light dried fruits, a touch of nuts, light dusty. Taste is rather sweet with loads of chewy caramel, a scent of choko, light dried fruits and touch of roast. Decent

Theres a kind of beauty within simplicity; leave it to German beer to make you constantly rediscover that fact. Asam Bock has a cola-colored body topped with a rich lather of foam that waits around for you. Its smells are grainy, chocolaty, syrupy, and fruity. Flavor goes the same way. Lovely touches of spice, molasses, and apricot. For a strong dark beer, this stuff is velvety smooth and unnaturally drinkable. Still, its a full-bodied beer thatll stick to your bones and palate. Its probably meant to be savored but I drained this in no time.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with deep reddish highlights. Head is creamy, off-tan, and fine-grained with lace. Nose is vanilla, caramel, roast pecans, black tea, beef broth, and fresh earth. On the tongue, it starts out molasses and camphor, then smooths out into a baking chocolate, spice, and date mixture. There are also elements of tea and spice, especially clove and nutmeg. Finish is dry, smoky, and dark. Wow.

Wysoka, sycząca piana, szybko opadająca do pierzynki. Barwa mahoniowa, klarowna. Aromat rodzynkowy, karmelowy, melanoidnowy (opiekana skórka od chleba głównie), w tle stary chmiel i zioła... W smaku dość słodko, generalnie powtórka tego co w zapachu plus suszone gruszki, ciemne winogrono, razowiec, kawa zbożowa. W afterteasie wędzone węgierki i zioła. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie do średniego, drobne, szczypiące, pełne i treściwe w odbiorze, z idealnie ukrytym alkoholem.

Gdyby nie ten delikatny kwas izowalerianowy w aromacie to piwo naprawdę klasy światowej, bardzo zbliżone profilem do Dubbla, w którym zamoczono "razowca" :)

500ml bottle. Pours a clear nut brown with a red hue and a large, creamy, long lasting, beige head that laces nicely. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, caramel, bread and dried fruit. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, caramel, dark fruit, licorice and bread with a mildly bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth, creamy, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very tasty. A world class doppelbock.

Very dark brown with medium light brown head. Aroma is caramel, grapes, dried fruit, nuts, actually some burnt rubber tire. Maybe there are more notes but the point is that it is really complex and nice. Taste could be much more. Only medium caramel sweetness and dark chocolate bitterness. A tiny bit of spicyness while swallowing with a finish of more of the aroma (grapes foremost). Medium heaviness. How can this have below 7 abv? Tastes like 8-10. Awesome!

Pours a very dark amber color with no head. Aroma is malt, bread, stone fruit, and slight warming spice. Taste is the same but a bit smokey, malt, bread, smoke, and stone fruit. Very dry and delicious, great example of the style.

Bottle. Really dark, brown in colour, nice white head. Aroma and taste is sweet, lots of toasted malt, some honey, flowers and lots of dried fruits. Medium body, moderate carbonation, rather sweetish in finish.

Bottle as a gift from Helsinki. BB 01.08.2017. Pours caramelly brown, appearing dark mahogany in the glass, with huge, thick, creamy head and beautiful lace. The aroma is lovely, rounded maltiness with a hint of roast, toast and leafy hops. Tastes as nice, moderate malty sweetness is continued by a stimulating wave of bitterness. Carbonation somewhat active but very fine. Creamy soft on the palate - such a treat! Alcohol only comes across as soothing warmth in the throat. Beautiful brew! Would love to have (more) such beers widely available around here.
330ml bottle. Pours black without head. Creamy mouthfeel. Chocolate, bit of caramel, raisins. More sweet than bitter, nicely complex.
Pours black with a small off-white head. Aroma has licorice, some caramel, chocolate and dark fruits. Taste is malty with some licorice, sweetness and a medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo.
Dark body, no head. Sweet chocolate aroma and cocoa. Taste is also sweet choco, roasted malt. Medium to full body, creamy and oily texture, flat carbonation. Very nice. //bottle at Valhalla
330 ml bottle. Pours deep ruby red/brown. Aroma is raisin, cherry, toasted bread. Taste is fruity with rich malt sweetness, toasted bread. Body is full and creamy. As for the mouthfeel. Very nice.

Nagy, nagyon tartós hab, szinte fekete, sötétbarna szín. Illata karamelles, csokis, enyhén fűszeres. Édeskés, karamelles, csokis, enyhén kakaóporos ízvilág, a komló csak jelzés értékű, de határozott. Közepesen testes, enyhén szénsavas és keserű. Csodásan kiegyensúlyozott, karakteres ízek.
Pours out jet black with a big tan head. Super rich with deep, deep chocolate notes. Velvety smooth texture. Superbly balanced. Subtle sweetness. This is top notch stuff!

$3.29 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours a dark brown-cola color with a large, soft tan head. Aroma of chocolate, bread, caramel, dark fruit. Flavor is all the same, with the addition of a hint of metal. Heavy caramel. Heavy deliciousness, too.
Brun öl med ett bra beige skum. Dofter och smaker av bränt socker, malt, och mörka frukter. Lite för söt för min smak.
Klares dunkles rotbraun mit reichlich Schaum. Sehr malzig, schwer, Karamell, dunkle Früchte, Röstaromen, etwas Schokolade, etwas würzig.

50 cl. flaske. @ hjemme til frokost meny og snaps.
Brun farve med beige skumkrone.
Smag: Sødme, risted malt, karamel og lakrids noter.
Medium krop og lav kulsyre.
Alt i alt en god dunkel duppelt bock.

Botella del @Hipercor. 07/06/2016. BBD: 12/01/2017
Color marron oscuro, sabor maltoso, caramelo,dulce.
0.5l bottle. Dark brown color with tanned head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel and dark fruits. Taste is sweet with dark fruit flavor. Overall its awesome beer with nice complexity.

Flasche - sehr dunkles, rotstichiges braun, fast schwarz. Stabiler Schaum. Aromen von dunklem Malz, Trockenfrüchten. Trocken im Abgang. Sehr rund und süffig. Alkohol kaum wahrnehmbar und etwas gering für einen Doppelbock.
Bottle from Keller meister. Deep Ruby brown colour with a light tan head. Aroma is bread, malts , and spices fruit. Taste is chocolate malty and light sweet.
Pours deep mahogany into a stem glass. Tan micro head with good retention recedes to coat surface. Dark pit fruit aromas. Sweet molasses, brown bread and raisins front to back.

Clear deep ruby and brown body. Medium beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, maderisation, caramel, spicies. Flavours of caramel, dried fruits, light chocolate notes, spicies. Medium sweet, dried fruits and bitter finish. A bit dry and a good bitter plum aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark chestnut body with a creamy tan head. Lovely aromas of brown bread, lightly spiced, malts, dark fruits. Breads, earthy. A hint of bitterness on the back end. Mild sweetness. Leather and chocolate notes. This is an outstanding example of a doppelbock.

Bottle, 500ml. A dark reddish beer with a small brown head. Aroma is of roasted malt, dried fruits, caramel and alcohol. Taste is moderately sweet with a malt finish and a dried fruits aftertaste. Medium bodied with some carbonation. Somewhat oily with a dense and rich body.

Bottle, 500cl. Deep reddish with a creamy tan head. Musky aromas of dried fruits, roasted caramel, nuts. brown sugar, alcohol. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Thick, oily and astringent. Medium sweet malty character with a medium to heavy bitter alcohol and fruity character. Exquisite.

Bottle received in the European trade thanks to SinH4. Chestnut brown with a large than head with good retention and lace. Brown sugar, wood, flowers, light over ripe bananas and minerals in the nose. Flavour follows; light bark, brown sugar, dusty cocoa, light honey minerals. Medium/full body, soft and oily texture, sweet with balanced bitterness. Good.

0,5lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
Warm aroma of caramel, roasted malts with nice beige head (last not long though). Nutty, caramel and roasted malt also in your mouth, the best thing, its not oo sweet - very balanced, with medium, drinkable body and medium cabonation. Overall, world class, as its little brother, Barock Dunkel!
Hvala Miru na ovom odličnom pivu....pio sam već jedno drugo pivo iz ove pivovare i očigledno je da ljudi znaju svoj posao...izgleda da proizvode dobro pivo...pun okus..malo jače pivo...super
Bottle at green sheep. Dark brown colour with a medium, lightbrown head. Nose of light roasted malts. Taste is low bitterness, low sweetness. Low carbonation. Roasted, caramelly taste. Nice.

Bouteille. Nez fruité (prunes, cerises noires, raisins), de malt rôti et sucré (caramel toffee et sucre bonbon) et quelques notes de noix, dalcool très doux et de chocolat noir. Assez ronde en bouche et moyennement pétillante. Goût assez fruité (prunes, cerises noires, notes de raisins) et très légèrement terreux avec des notes de mélasse et de réglisse noire lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté assez sucré de caramel toffee (notes de sucre brun/bonbon) et rôti auquel se rajoute un goût légèrement amer de chocolat noir et dalcool doux. Arrière-goût moyen-long, légèrement amer de rôti dalcool doux et de chocolat noir léger avec un goût fruité (pelures de prunes et de raisins) et un tout petit goût de noix. [notes 2006]

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ El Corte Ingles, Sevilla, España.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malt, sweet, licorice / Malta tostada, dulce, regaliz.
German beer styles, this is fantastic. Beer bodied, balanced and expertly made, dense, with just the right touch of alcohol. A pleasure

0,5l bottle at home from trade with SinH4, big thanks. BB . dark brown color, small tan head. smells of licorice, caramel, lightly fruity, plums, honey, decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of caramel, malty sweetness, light licorice, creamy, spices. finishes rather sweet with notes of spices and caramel. overall good stuff, like so many bocks a bit on the heavy side but overall one of the better ones.
Great beer. Nice bocky thickness, taste almost like a Russian stout but easier to drink. High notes of cream. Nicely paired with a knackwurst!

500ml bottle. No discernible date. Appearance: Deep brown with ruby red tint and a thick khaki head that lingers. 
Aroma: Raisin, cherry, fig, toasted bread, and a touch of alcohol. 
Taste: Rich malt sweetness, toasted bread prominent, with a strong dark fruit flavor reminiscent of plum and dark cherry. Moderate bitterness enough to balance the rich malt. 
Mouthfeel: Medium to heavy body with some creaminess for the style, moderate carbonation, and a hint of alcohol on the swallow. 
Finish: Toasted bread lingers long after the swallow with a touch of fruit. 
Overall: On the low end of a Doppelbock intensity scale, closer to a traditional bock in that respect. However, the rich dark fruit aroma in flavor more in line with Doppelbock. Either way, an outstanding beer. Complex aroma and flavor profile, balancing the toasted bread Munich malt character with well developed fruitiness of plums, cherries, and raisins.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2016 Bottle 500ml. Served just below cellar temp. Pours a clear, dark redish brown with a lightly tanned, frothy head that lasts perfectly. Aroma is rich and malty with notes of burnt toffee, muscatels, dates, liquorice and raisin milk chocolate. Flavour is smooth and silky with a light bitterness, roasted barley, toffee, brown sugar, raisins, sultanas, dried currants, milk chocolate and liquorice. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a long roasted finish. A truly amazing Doppelbock in every respect; perfectly balanced and dangerously sessionable.

Black in the glass, small fast fading beige head. Wood, alcohol, malt in a nice composition on the nose. A lot of toasted malt with a pleasant sweetness at the start. Little bit alcoholic, hints of licorice. Long lasting malty mouthfeel

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Color rubino scuro con riflessi rubino e caramello, schiuma beige di persistenza medio-bassa.
Aroma di nocciole, pane nero, prugna, fichi secchi, caramello ed erbaceo.
Al palato attacca dolce di caramello e prugna, successivamente nocciola e pane tostato, coda amaricante tostata ed erbacea mista a caramellato molto persistente, lievemente acidula.
Corpo medio-pieno, mediamente carbonata.
Bottle from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is roasted malts, mild soy sauce. Taste is tangy, thick roasted malts. Some boozy, herbal liqueur quality in there too.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2016 Bottle 50cl. Clear brilliant amber brown, large frothy beige head, good retention and lacing; aroma is roasted malts, dried dark fruits, brown sugar, licorice; taste is light heavy sweet and medium bitter, malty, roasty, toffee, with average duration, aftertaste is sweetbitter, toasted caramel, spicy notes, chocolate tones; medium body, creamy to sticky texture, soft carbonation; excellent Doppelbock.
Very dark brown color with white foam layer. The smell is dark and heavy. The taste is foamy carbonated and has a heavy licorice round balanced taste. The aftertaste is very smooth.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Heavy and full, almost gravy-meaty, lots of umami. Lasting thick finish. Powerful!

Flasche 0,5l: Schwarz, dunkles Mahagoni, klar, kräftiger feinporiger fester Schaum; kräftige dunkle Süße in der Nase, Malzzucker, angenehme Würze, Röstaromen, Tannine, etwas Holz; im Körper kräftige dunkle Süße, Röstmalz, kräftige Würze, Röstaromen, sehr cremig, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, recht trocken; sehr angenehmer trocken-würziger Nachgang
En vildt lækker øl. Flaske. Farven er mørk, rødlig brun med en beige . Aromaen er mørk frugt, rosiner og blommer. Smagen er rosiner malt og nødder.

,5l pour from refrigerated bottled into stemmed lager glass in Kazakhstan. Pours a ruby brown, mostly opaque, with a fizzy light-tan head. Nose is sweet and pleasant-- brown sugar, caramel, plums, raisin, maybe a bit of nuttiness. Body is medium; mouthfeel is oily. A bit fizzy. Taste is far on the sweet side. Fruity, with cherry notes dominating the front on. Those gives way to other dark fruits-- plums, raisins, and fig. Some matliness in the background. Dry all around. Moderate bitterness and only a hint of an alcohol bite on the end. I suspect it may grow more prominent as the beer warms, however. A little off balance in flavor, but overall a sweet and enjoyable dessert beer.

Dark brown color with ruby highlight and a big beige head. Aroma is nutty, malty, caramel, molasses, also some fresh fruits. Taste is toffee, caramel, nutty, with some vanilla and wood, maybe a slight booze sting, but I wouldnt call it sweet. Oily mouthfeel, but with carbonation. A truly amazing Doppelbock.

500 ml bottle poured. Pours black with a slight red tint to it. Dark fruit heavy aroma, with raisin, plum, grape, and a little spice. Flavor has a cherry, raisin front, with a roasted brown sugar background. Toasty in the finish, with a lingering sugar sweetness. Sometimes when my curiosity takes me around to a new style, I accidentally pick up one of the highest rated Doppelbocks, and quite enjoy it in the process.unique beer with a ton of character. Very enjoyable.

Wonderful aroma of prunes, berries, chcolate chip cookie malts. Sweet malts then some bitterness. Not a heavy beer in terms of body and mouthfeel bit it will rock you. Finish is dry, floral, and kind of boozy. My kind of beer.
Awesome taste. Bottled, nice pour. Minimal foam, nutty, caramel overtones. Couldnt have thought of a better beer at the end of the day.

Bottle @ home. Brown colour with a small off-white head. Smells sweet, malts, slightly roasty and caramel. Tastes slightly liquorice, sweet, malty, roasty and breadcrust. Pretty nice overal. Slightly silky feel, medium body, soft carbo.
Draft at Edelweiss. Pours dark nut brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like raisins, malty, earthy, nutty. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like raisins, nutty, malty, and earthy.

A dark mahogany coloured beer with a medium sized, quite longlasting tan head. The remaining foam is slowly fading. Nice aromas of herbal and floral hops, bit of dark chocolate, roasted malt, burned toast, bread, alcohol, caramel, yeast, rum truffle, woody tones and dryed prunes. Quite hoppy in taste for a Doppelbock, some schnapps, kirsch i would say, long dry finish, . Thick texture, almost mealy, soft carbonation, full body.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A brown opaque mahony beer with a medium beige head ; medium retention. Roasty and toasty aroma, light caramel, dry fruits, sugar, prune. Light to medium sweet, light dry, bitter note, light warming. Medium body, average texture, light oily, average carbonation, fruity roasty finish, light dry. Overall, a good dark malty beer ; highly drinkable !

Fort goût de caramel avec un arrière fumé plaisant. Pas mal de corps mais sans pour autant laisser transparaître beaucoup dalcool.
Le final et la longueur vont vers des notes sauce soja très douces.

500 ml bottle. Clear deep ruby copper, fading tan foam. Aroma and taste of sweet rich nutty malts, caramel, hint of chocolate, some cola in the finish. Softer carbonation, medium bodied, low hopped. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)
Jadore les bières allemandes, celle-ci ne déroge pas à la règle. Et bien forte comme il se doit.

0,5 Flasche aus einem lokalen Getränkemarkt. Kupfer- bis karamellfarbend, eher trüb, gut Kohlensäure, cremige Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Gewürzen, süßlich, nach Karamell, Lakritze, Röstaromen. Schmeckt zu erst süßlich, karamellig, würzig, evtl. Cassis, dann leicht nach Alkohol und minimal bitter-hopfig. Sehr ölig im Mund

Dark red/brown beer with light brown head. Nice yummie aroma of prunes. The taste has a really good balance between the light roasted taste from the dark malts and a light sweetness from the caramel malts. The prunes are present in the taste as well. When sipping along the sweetness seem to dominate though, but in a good way. Good carbonation and body. This is a really good bock in my opinion!
Bottle in garden, 19th July 2015. Dark. Aroma is toffee, caramel, burnt. Taste is caramel, black treacle, slight bitter mostly sweet, rich. Well balanced. Good
From Hipercor. In Paulaner glass. Playing Magic 2015. Im not used to this style, so it feels a bit odd to me. However, ot can be drinked without too much suffering.
Aroma complejo y potente: malta tostada, frutas, chocolate... Mucho cuerpo, sabor a caramelo, cacao. Completa y muy sabrosa.

Color marrón oscuro. Espuma beige media (2 dedos). Aroma complejo y potente: malta tostada, frutas, chocolate... Mucho cuerpo, sabor a caramelo, cacao. Super equilibrada de princpio a fin, completa y muy sabrosa. Regusto ligeramente alcohólico que perdura...pidiendo el siguiente trago. Muy buena.

Bottle from Beer Merchants. It pours dark brown with decent beige. The nose is sweet, cola, dried fruits, fruit cake, earthy, umami, roasted malts and chocolate biscuits. The taste is sweet, rich maltage, roasty malts, toffee, cola, earth, toasty, dried fruits, fruit cake, light alcohol warmth and treacle with sweetish finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Solid malty action.

Bottle, Restaurang Rauhrackel, Lund, 4 June 2015. Pours a dark, ruddy brown/black, good head and lacing. The nose is reticent: whiffs of violets, if that's not too fanciful. Sweet cherries on the palate, heavy mouthfeel yet quite elegant. A good traditional bock and even a bit exotic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours translucent chocolate brown with a fairly thick light tan head. Crisp, malty aroma has an overtone of apple touched with pear. Flavor is considerably richer than the aroma, fuller in character and bringing notes of caramel and cloves into play. Mouthfeel has decent fizz, if average body. Enjoy.

0,5 l bottle from Rudat, bottled on 28/10/2014. Clear, very dark red with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Pleasant, sweetish-fruity aroma of raisins, plums, amarena cherries and cane sugar. Sweetish-fruity taste of amarena cherries, raisins, plums and cane sugar, accompanied by hints of dark chocolate, nuts and coffee. Medium long, slightly bitter, gently alcoholic and warming finish. Clear dark brown body with a thick beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, dark fruit. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Oily texture, full body, dry bitter finish. Nice beer.

Had this for a while, I think o forgot it was supposed to be good. But good it is. Big caramelized malt aroma with some booze and a hint of citrus even. Light roast and nut. Pours very dark brown with good head and lacing. Bittersweet finish. Bottle from Total Wine.

thin creamy tan head. clear deep burgundy pour. Subtĺe bitter sweetness. Well balanced.

Asam Bock pours clear dark reddish amber and sports a tan head of medium lifetime. Elle est brune, aux reflets rouge, ayant une mousse beige, crémeuse et soyeuse qui se tient en place. Bottle. Dark brown, small to average and mostly lasting light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, light caramel and roasted malt, some dark fruits - light vinous notes and faint chocolate. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, light caramel and roasted malt, light dark fruits, light chocolate. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light roasted malt and light dark fruits, light chocolate, faint alcohol. Really nice doppelbock with vinous notes - not too sweet/not too much alcohol.
Bottle. Very dark brown with small tan head. Aroma of brownie, toff3e and nuts. Taste is quite rich, toffee and nuts, touch of chocolate. Full bodied with a slightly bitter finish. Decent

Bottle 500 ml, thanks to Mctapps! Into a snifter, ABV 6.9%
Deep mahogany brown colour on the body, with almost two fingers of beige head on top, thick, with good retention. Light lacing around the glass. 
Aroma of chocolate, toasted malts.
Taste is sweet with chocolate, malts, faint metallic notes that dont become annoying, light vanilla. Mildly bitter on the aftertaste.
Medium thick body, carbonation on good levels.
Great bock, its beers like this one that make me prefer the german bocks over the dutch ones.

Very dark copper colour with tan, disappearing head. Aroma of both dried and black fruits, toasted bread, chocolate and caramel. Sticky texture, full bodied. Sweet, light bitterness, medium carbonation. Probably the best bock Ive tried so far.

Doppelbock, który wyjątkowo mi leżał. W aromacie więcej suszonych owoców niż karmelu, co było wielkim plusem. W smaku bardziej wytrawne niż większość doppelbocków, choć nuty karmelowe wyraźne, ponadto sporo nut winnych. Dobrze ułożone i zaskakująco pijalne. Po czasie wychodzi lekki alkohol, mogłoby być lepiej pod tym względem. Niemniej jedna smaczne piwo.

The last bottle in the area, apparently. Pours very dark brown to black with almost no head, just a very thin eggshell ring and a touch of soapy lace. Nose involves prominent roasted barley, toasted notes, wintergreen, some savory meat drippings (sorry, been reading all the CIB ratings haha), some raisin and prune dried dark fruit notes, some light vinyl. Pretty sweet flavor, somewhat bitter. Medium to full bodied, quite soft carb, a bit oily, almost somewhat watery somehow, with a lengthy toasted, soy-tinged bitter finish. No idea how old this is, but Im guessing its fairly old based on from where it was procured and what little knowledge I have of its distribution in the area. Regardless, a decent brew, fun to try, and fresher I would assume this would be a pretty decent example of the style.

500ml bottle. Clear chestnut brown pour, thick, but short-lived, off-white head. Aromas of malty caramel, toffee, maybe honey. All sugary stuff though. Taste brings a fruitier note. Clean finish. Pretty good.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2014 Really good nose here. Very rich deep prune and brown sugar with a salivating meat quality. Deep dark glossy brown colour too which formed an easy dense thick smooth head which did mostly goes the distance.
Rich dark chocolate on the palate ending with an earthy dryness. The feel is full but there are some overcurrents of fizziness but this doesnt take away from its luxurious richness.
On tap. Brown in color with a good sized beige head. Aroma is of chocolate, clove, light prune, and tons of rich malty notes. Taste is of chocolate, malt, caramel, and toast with molasses.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Pours a very beautiful clear dark ruby brown with a medium head. The aroma is quite sweet, with malty toasts, cereals and dark fruits. The taste is sweet as well from the malts, with just enough hops to balance them out. Very well done. Medium body, light to medium carbonation. All in all, a fantastic drinking experience.

Bottle shared at Kerrys mini tasting. Toffee, caramel, umami & pitted fruit aroma. Dark reddish brown pour with an orange beige head. Sweet, malty caramel, zesty, citrus & toffee. Tasty & sweet. Solid.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Bottle 500ml. My best german Doppelbock so far: dark coffee brown color, light brown head. Very rich dark malt aroma, a bit sweet. Full taste of dark malt, coffee, dark chocolate and liquorice. Light bitterness. Average carbonation, medium bitter finish, well hidden alcohol. Complex and beautifully composed beer.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks Yoav. Clear dark brown with cream colour head. Sweet, grain then dried fruit and plum aroma, sweet, ripe fruit that becomes dry taste. Full body, smooth and grainy finish.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a glass. Pours dark brown with medium brown highlight and medium/big beige head. Roasty aroma, medium body, medium/light carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is roast, smoke, and some toffee. Pretty good beer.

Bottle split at JFs, from Beermerchants, 26/12/13.
Extremely dark mahogony brown with a moderate beige covering.
Nose is dark malt, brown sugars, bready malts, dark toffee, sweet aromas.
Taste comprises brown bread dough, sweet tones, fruit loaf, toffee, brown sugars.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet finale.
Decent bock.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a deep, dark brown with a medium light brown head. Smells somewhat strange but tastes good. Biscuit and malt notes.

Pours super dark brown with a good head, as expected for the style. Aromas of roasted malts and treacle. Taste is caramel, honey, Vegemite, roasted banana and some charred meat in the finish. Mouthfeel is medium bodied but a little less creamy than expected. Overall, quite different to my beloved Korbinian but good nonetheless.

Poured from 500mL bottle. Clear, dark brown with beige head. Malty, caramel, molasses aroma and flavour and something I cant quite put my finger on. Little bit of nuttiness too. Medium body.

Dark brown colour with a beige head, disappearing. Smell is malty and roasted, taste is malty too, with caramel and bread notes.
Also some fruity notes, like plum or similar. 
A very good Doppelbock.

Secular beer with associated bock taste. Better than their dunkel. Typical monastery brew. Go find it. Will pare well with a light cheddar or tough provelone. 

---all in good suds.
Bottle. Pours translucent brown, head doesnt last. Nose is strong nuttiness, toasty, caramel. Nuts, dark fruit, sweet malt in the flavour. Quite sweet.
Dark amber body. Sweet molasses aroma. Very sweet taste brown sugar caramel. No hops. Tasty.
Pours a chestnut brown with strong and sweet aromas of molasses, banana bread and vanilla. Flavors are sweet Bready malts, burnt sugar, and molasses. Nice.

Rating #777 - Nov 18, 2013. Celebrating lucky triple 7 with a 100 style rb brew. 8 oz on draught at Beer Revolution. Dark brown pour with a tan head that fades fairly slowly. Mild-medium carbonation. Aroma is coffee, hint of toffee and roasted malt. Taste is all over the map for me, yeast, wheat, mild smoke, and just super almond/walnutty. Off balance and not to my taste at all. Old keg? Poor tap? Will have to re-rate...

Aroma heeft iets van nuts en zoutigheid.
Mooi dik schuim die lang staan.
Smaak: nuts en karamel. Ligt en zoetig. Nasmaak iets scherps. Nasmaak is mij iets te zoet.

Couleur brune claire, tres peu de carbo et un tout petit col fuyant.
Des aromes tres marques sur les malts torrefies.
Un palais moyennement rond, final cafe et grille.
Une tres bonne Doppelbock

Heavy dark amber with a foamy thin light beige head. The nose is dark and malty with a bit of syrupy molasses/licorice and a little fig. Taste is malty and dark with sweet dates and figs, but mostly earthy toffee and toasted biscuits. Has a little bit of scotch ale-malt and peat note about it. Frankly, tastes more like a scotch ale.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 50cl bb07/2013. Undershelming old school (=pre-1895) Doppelbock, somewhere in between Ganter Wodans brown sugary depths and Celebrators liquorice bomb. Bready, prune marmelade, some pepper. Maybe this has lost some in aging, becoming flat? Not too keen to have fresh, but will sample on tap when presented. / Rerate aged 1-yr old bottle bb08/2013: still that upfrontliquorice and prune marmelade, but coming together very harnoniously and for a Bock almost a joy to sip (still couldnt finish the whole bottle though). Carries all of its aromas on its sleeve, after which an empty stage...

Pours clear deep walnut brown tinted to amber with a very thick beige head. Settles to a yeasty coating. Aroma is bready, toasted malt and nuttiness. Taste is intensely malty. Bread soaked in caramel sweetness. Roast malt on the back end with a touch of bitterness to balance. Low carbonation. Wow. Right up there with Celebrator.

500 ml bottle. Pours a very dark mahogany with full head. Aromas of molasses, caramel and roasted malts. Flavors of sweet caramel, brownies, and nuts with a hint of spice. Very nice

500ml bottle. Ruddy brown with beige head. Lightly toasted malt, caramel, dark berries, licorice, earthy yeasts. Subtle flavours, not too sweet. Velvety mouthfeel. Gradual alcohol warmth. Dry and crisp on the finish.

Color caramelo rojizo, limprio y con espuma marfil densa y duradera. Aromas de azúcar moreno, regaliz, caramelo, frutos rojos y tostados. En boca entra dulce y ligera con matices de miel y caramelo. El final tiene un ligero amargor muy balanceado con su inicio. El regusto es meloso y muy agradable. Excelente.

At Iron Abbey. Dark dark brown off white head. Big malty flavor, full palate. Notes of dark fruit and toasted malts. Nose is malty and a hint of roast. Hops and alcohol present but this is principally dark malts.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Globo. Color marrón muy oscuro con tintes rubi profundo a contraluz. Espuma beige claro que presenta buena retención. Aromas de maltas caramelo y tostadas dulces, trazos de chocolate y extracto de regaliz con notas de ciruelas pasas y dátiles. Entrada cremosa y torrefacta. Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonatación moderada. Textura densa y paladar sedoso. El chocolate y el regaliz lo inundan todo. Final ducle tostado y retrogusto afrutado con matices de maltas quemadas. Un buen trabajo !!
330ml bottle. Snifter glass. Very dark brown color, deep ruby tints to the light. Light beige froth shows good retention. Caramel & sweet toasted malt aromas, chocolate & extract of licorice hues as well as notes of prune & dats to the nose. Creamy & roasted upfront. Medium to full body. Moderate carbonation. Dense texture & silky palate. Chocolate & licorice all over. Sweet toasted finish & fruity aftertaste with hints of burnt malts. Good job !!
Close to black beer with a foamy creamy head. Aroma is dark malty, chocolate, roasty and sweet. Medium body, smooth a bit sweet malty taste. Very balanced and good. Will get me another one.
Malty aromas without any hop detected. Good body equilibrated with sweetness. Toast caramel tastes that makes it perfect and good to drink
Bottle 0.5l at home. Originally rated 22092012. Colour is dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, chocolate, caramel and malts.

Bottle 33 CL. Brown dark color with brown white lacing head. Taste is roasted, nutty, wood, caramel, chocolate. Very tasty with loads of flavor and easy to drink. Smooth. Great brew.-- via beerbasher/winphone
Draft - Raisin, toffee, roasted malts and a bit of booze. Dark caramel amber with a brown head. Fruitcake galore, bready with dark fruits and roasted malts with a bitter finish,

A: Dark mahogany, almost opaque, small tanned head which disappeared quickly. S: Raisins, molasses, dark chocolate. T: Raisins, prune, dark chocolate, sweet molasses come through as it warms, booze well hidden, hint of burned caramel at the finish. M: smooth, thick but not overly heavy. Minimal carbonation. O: Very well made dopplebock, a sipper, could have used a touch more bitterness but hard to find fault.

An excellent Bock from the people who are supposed to make it best: Germany! If you don't serve it too cold and pour it right, you will get a great thick head. This is a dark bock, darker than I usually see. Tastes of caramel,java, and a bit of nut and toffee! Yum. Close your eyes a take a sip of this and you will swear your in a beer garten in a small hovel in the fatherland!

Pours a dark brown from the bottle with thin tan head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of sweet caramel and toffee, a back end of bready grain. Taste follows, with a hint of soy and German yeast. Good, but nothing fantastic, a bit too sweet.

(on tap) Dark brown, reddish colour. Small light brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, like German dark bread. Dried fruits, like plums. Some mineral/chalky notes. Complex and tasty - just not so much my taste. Medium body, medium sweetness, light bitterness. This is a good and very malty beer. Not really my kind of beer though, hence the seemingly low rating. I preferred their Dunkel.

Reddish dark brown beer with a small beige head dissolving into a permanent circle around the glass with some lacing. Aroma has dark bread, chocolate sweetness and malts with some nuttyness, earthy and herbal notes. Taste combines the dark bread and chocolate sweetness with some saltiness. As the beer warms up some coffee and licorice also appear. The mouthfeel is really nicely thick and oily. Not much of bitterness in the finish, which is quite short.
Nice nutty toffee aroma. Roasted malt flavor, some caramel, bitter coffee finish. Very well balanced dark doppelbock.
bottle 33 cl @ home. Pours dark copper with a medium beige head. Sweet malty aroma with some coffee notes. Sweet malty flavor with some chocolate. Very nice and balanced.

Dark brown, almost no head.
Aroma has toffee, nuts. 
Very sweet nutty flavor. Like peanutbutter.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a minimal head. Sweet aroma of roasted malt. Sweet, slightly bitter taste.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours clear dark mahogany with a powerful, big rock steady creamy off-white head. Aroma is full malty, light roast,dark caramel and bread. Smooth and soft mouthfeel, loads of malty goodies here,caramel, bread, light roast and chocolate. Well hidden alcohol, one of the better doppelbock´s I have had.
Room temp bottle. BB Sep 13. Dark brown, v big expanding beige head. Smells of chocolate, caramel, yeasty marmite. Taste is yeasty, bit sharp, some chocolate, ashy finish.

Beer poors a deep mahogany black, with a thin white head that disappeared immediately. Aroma is fantastic, with strong stone fruit, roasted malt and a light alcohol presence. No hop or yeast aromas are present. Flavor has an excellent sweet toasty character, not cloying. Minimal hop bitterness that seems to work in concert with slight roast bitterness. Medium to medium full body, not thick. Carbonation is minimal, seems light for style. Finish is spot on. Overall awesome beer. Very drinkable, only criticism is minimal carbonation.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with thin tan head, big roasted malt aroma, big bold fruit and malt taste with molasses.

Botella 33cl. Aroma muy intenso y complejo, con notas tostadas. De sabor casi perfecta, con un ligero amargor, espuma escasa pero persistente y color muy oscuro. De las mejores cervezas que he probado

A lady at the LCBO told me that thios is being discontinued in Ontario in favour of other offerings by different breweries so I decided to grab a couple of the remaining bottles and try it out. The beer is a dark brown colour with a thin tan coloured head. The aroma is grass, with some fruit hints, and a touch of hops. The flavour is still the grass, but some spiciness creeps in. I liked it. Should have bought the other bottles!

330ml bottle. Liquorice, nuts, caramel aromas. Pours dark, with nice tan head, persistent, some lacing. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, thick texture. Taste is malty, nuts, caramel, some roasty flavours. Well balanced. Very enjoyable.

0,5 l bottle BB 23. Oct 13  
caramel, bread, coffee, roasty, floral, spruce, citrus, earthy, alcohol, vanilla, brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Dark brown with ruby notes through the light; slightly chocolatey aroma but not much; Flava is very complex malty sweet yet spiciness like cardamom; feels light finishes dry
Complex aroma with various malts. Color is a deep dark brown with a ruby one to it. The head was small and disappeared quickly. Deep rich taste with a slight bitterness to it.

Apariencia: Color marrón oscuro y espuma beige bastante duradera.
Aroma: A maltas, toffe, licor y frutos rojos.
Sabor: A caramelo y licor con un peculiar y agradable final amargo.

Really deep ruby red almost black with a light beige head (quickly diminishing). Aroma is dark fruit, bready malt and yeast. Flavour is sweet, a tiny bit of sourness and then a really light bitterness in the finish. Texture is oily, carbonation is light. Not overly impressed at first although it got a bit better as it went on.

Bottle from Stirchleywines. Brown beer with small head. Aroma of malts and brown treacle. The taste is malts, licorice and some sweet treacle. Quite full bodied, which I like, but too sticky. My first doppelbock. Nice experience, need to try more.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Chesnut brown, off-white head. Aroma: roasted malts, chocolate, demerara sugar, dark fruits. Taste: sweet roasted malts, sticky dark fruits (prunes, plums), liqourice, a touch of marzipan. Full-bodied, rich & chewy on the tongue. Clean finish. Great balance.

Deep brown color with a small reddish affect, creamy beige foam. Beautiful :)
Complex aroma of dried fruit, malt and grain, marzipan.
  Smooth and sweet tasting yet softly balanced by hop with a nice uplifting flavor to the thick and sweet roasted malt. Smooth and durable finish.
The alcohol content is noticeable but not intrusive throughout, lightly carbonated.

Excellent .</
Just drink and smile because whatever else happens. :)
Bottle from Getränkeland, Hvidovre. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of caramal, roasted malt, nuts and with chocolate notes.

500 ml bottle shared with friend @ Amundsen,Oslo.April 13,2013
A bit to cold beer tasted from tulip glass with a nice portwine on the side.
Dark brown in color.
Aroma is caramel,malt and some fruits.
A nice malty and bittersweet taste and finish.

De color marron oscuro casi negro, espuma color beige de muy poca retencion. Aroma dulce, matices de caramelo, frutas maduras, pasas y maltas torrefactas. Dulce en boca con notas de caramelo, chocolate, pasas y maltas tostadas. Cuerpo medio/entero, carbonatacion media y final dulce y amargo
33cl bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon. Very dark color with medium brownish head. Carbonation is medium. Sweetness is medium to low, bitterness low. Aroma is caramel, toasted. Nice!
Beautiful dark ruby color. Nice malty sweet aroma. Body seem light considering huge malt flavor and aroma. Good bock beer.

[Thanks to fugitive]. Bottled. Dark brown colour with a beige head with an average duration. Aroma is toasty, caramel, malty, chocolate plumbcake. Flavor is toasted malts, chocolate, caramel, high presenc of dry fruits, mainly nuts, sweet. The final is nutty with chocolate plumbcake notes, toast bread. Smooth and dense on palate.
Bottle. Pours clear dark copper with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt with a touch of caramel. Dark, bittersweet flavour of roasted malt. Coffeelike finish. Yummy.
Bottle intoto snifter.  Dark brown.  Very sweet for a bock.  Tree bark.  Nutty.  Good for a bock but not my style.

Bottle 50cl, an amber beer with medium head. Nose is on caramel, brown malt and brown bread. Aroma is on caramel, toffee, malty body, dried fruits, intense caramel body, light toasted touch, sweet, brown bread, long malty aftertaste. Excellent and smooth body, complex and easy drinkable.

0.5l bottle. Very dark body, tan head. Toffee and dark fruits in the aroma. Its pretty weak though. Plums, reisins and some roastyness in the sip. There is a little floral hop bitterness in the finish, but mostly roasted malts. Not bad, but not much in it for me.

Pours dark brown clear with purple hue. Mocha off-white head is medium full-bodied and dense, Aroma include licorice, leather, fruits, plums, sweet mats. Palate is soft, oily and smooth. Carbonation is flat and smooth. Taste has a lot nuances, from roasted malts, licorice to dry hops and tart fruitiness. Finish is warm from ABV, slightly dry but fruity same time. Overall quite complex of a D-Bock and very tasty. Nice beer.

bottle Beers of Europe. lovely sweet caramel and brown sugar flavours. Chocolate notes, smooth soft palate, some faint burnt roast aroma. A bit of licquorice comes in midway with coffee in there too. Probably my favourite German style of beer. Great stuff

Deep ruby, almost black; light chocolatey aroma; sweet, dark, bready malt, a bit of dark chocolate; simple but very effective; not in the same league as the awesome Ayinger Celebrator - the only other doppelbock Ive tried - but nevertheless this has increased my thirst for the style.

dark brown colour with moderate beige head; aroma of roasted sugar and coffee with some yeast; taste of coffee, roasted (almost burnt) sugar; malty sweetness some sourness with bitter aftertaste...a bit too much roasted taste for me

50 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 11.03.2010
Aroma is malty with chocolate, roasted notes and hints of coffee. Flavour has bready malt, roasted notes, semi‐dark chocolate, caramel and hints of cocoa. Rather confusing doppelbock; on some occasions this is too sweet and sometimes not.
Bottle.Dark Brown colour with a fluffy off-head. Aroma is rosted malty, hints of caramel. Flavor is roasted malt, hints of nuts and caramel. Mouthfeel is slight bitter.

Bottle, best by 1/7/2013.
Nice doppelbock.  Malty aroma with hints of alcohol in the nose.  Malty flavor, slightly rich, with slight bready-ness and finishes slightly sweet.  Crystal clear, although dark, with ruby highlights. Medium body, clean.  Maltyness lingers in the finish nicely.  A good example and interpretation of the style.
Great taste explosion where a burnt malt flavor meets licorice, dried fruit, almonds, toffee. Closing with a light crisp bitterness perfectly balanced against the rich fullness.

Kaatuu lasiin syvän tummanruskeana, vaahto on vaaleanruskea ja melko muhkea. Haju on maitoisen ja voisen maltainen, mukana on myös suklaata, paahteisuutta, kahvia ja lievää hedelmäisyyttä sekä ruohoisuutta. Deep red-to-dark color with heavy tan head. Strong nutty caramel in aroma. Taste is complex and full of coffee, caramel and chocolate. Heavy body with medium carbonation, alcohol well hidden.

(draught 0,5l @ Netopýr (Brno))
Very sweet, dried fruit aroma. Dark brown-ruby color. All time creamy beige head. Medium sweet, very light fruity sour, sweet chocolate, caramel taste. Medium-full body. Sticky texture. Ligth astringent, light dry finish. Tastes and smells more like baltic porter.

Comprado en  CErvezorama. Grandes sorpresas se esconden detrás de etiquetas poco atractivas y precios bajos. Para todos los amantes del lúpulo les animaría a que se animaran con alguna de estas joyas germánicas. De color caramelo, sin exceso de carbonatación, aromas a caramelo, frutos secos tostados, algo de lúpulo. Sabor maltoso, caramelo, nueces. Cerveza de trago largo con el alcohol muy integrado y un postgusto muy agradable. Elegante. Sensacional.
500 ml. bottle.  Pours a dark brown with a nice light tan head.  Aroma of malt, caramel, and fruit.  Taste is caramel malt, dried dark fruit, bread, and a bit of chocolate.  Very nice!

Aroma is pretty tasty... Almost some raisiny Belgian notes, but of course with a very German sweet malt-molasses smell. Taste is molasses, little hops detectable, nice thickness to it. Finishes smooth, with lingering sweetness without being annoying. I likey.

14/12/2012 on tap @ GEIB. Bruna, schiuma biancastra poco abbondante e non molto persistente. Al naso sentori di malto, caramello, biscotto, mou. In bocca è dolce, caramello, mou, liquirizia. Corpo medio-pieno, carbonazione soft. Buona, ma banale come molte doppelbock e stucchevole alla lunga.

Karamellig, sehr vollmundig,  
kräftiges starkes Bier,
leicht alkoholisch, Alc. 6,9 %

dark brown with nice frothy tan head, good lacing, looks great.  Aroma has a touch of prune, burnt sugar, faint whisp of smoke, very subtle vegetable, as it warms raisin and other dark fruit, touch of honey.  Flavor adds in chocolate, leaves, less fruity than aroma, touch of roast, some licorice.  Couple of sips the finish felt muted but it starts to come through after about half way through.  Very drinkable, medium bodied, enjoyable brew.

500ml bottle. Clear, deep reddish darkest brown colour with small to average, frothy to creamy, beige head. Minimally roasty, slighlty chocolately dark malty aroma. Taste is moderately sweet caramel malty, minimally roasty, malt lozenge. Intense malty, slightly monotonous, not too heavy, easy drinkable Doppelbock.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Usually the Weltenburger beers hit me. But this was a mixture of dulllness and huge alcohol. Hated it in a special. Not the worst beer of my life but a bad one.

Cola color with cappuccino like head, the head is so creamy and thick its amazing. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, cake, bread. Taste is sweet, like the aroma, no bitterness at all, nice balance its not too sweet. May be the best Dunkeler Doppelbock I had

Bottle. This pours a very dark brown with a nice layar of tanned head on top. Head leaves fairly quick, within two minutes or so. Very malty based aroma, earthy notes and a light, alcoholic smell to it as well. Flavour is spiced sweet, very full bodied, full of the earthy notes and even a bit of a roasty character, at least there is some burnt caramel and molasses in there. This is an awesome example of how a doppelbock should be in my honest opinion. Too bad I only brought one bottle..
Ist ziemlich stark bei Alkohol und Aroma. Das 1050 schmeckt mir besser. Aber das ist ja Geschmackssache.

500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe into a pint glass.  Very dark red brown with a creamy bubbly head.  Great rich aroma, roasty.  Complex, full-bodied, light roast after taste, very smooth and flavoursome.  Just a touch boozy.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2014 .5l bottle purchased near brewery in Bavaria. Dated BB Feb. 2013 and consumed in August 2012.

Pours a clear but very dark brown with mahogany highlights and a medium tan head. The head has good retention and leaves spotty lacing. 

A refined malty aroma with a hint of liqueur. The flavor [8.5] is parallel, albeit with a more pronounced and richer dark malt component. Lasting, lightly bitter, dark malt aftertaste. Smooth, yet it has enough carbonation to impart a significant liveliness. 

O: Superb, and notably better than the nice Kloster Ettal dopplebock I had earlier in the day.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Okay, so Ive drunk too many Doppelbocks lately and honestly Im sick of them. But nevertheless I think I can rate them as objective as possible. Taste of dark, roasted nuts, rich malt and caramel. Low bitterness, medium-balanced carbonation. Too dull for my taste but with hints of strong alcohol. A shot of schnapps would do the same.

Bottle at DØE tasting.
Clear redbrown with a little head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, roasted, dark fruit). Flavor heavy sweet, light bitter. Almost full body, sirupy, fat. Nice!
Bottle bought in a bordershop close to Heiligenhafen. Sweet malty taste with dried fruit. Similar taste, malty wineous. Nice to sip at, almost like a barley wine but thiner and lighter.

500 ml. bottle obtained in a trade with Thirstybird / split @ hotelroom durring Borefts 2012 with Belgbeergeek and Benzai - copper / darker ruby with a solid white head - smells of lager yeast, spices, caramel, toffee, some dark sugar - taste is sweet malts, darker sugar, dark fruits, rather heavy iron, caramel, toffee, bitter hops and some spices in the back - medium bodied, lower carb.  - not a bad doppelbock but as usual with these styles - the rating on here confuses me

Bomber bottle poured a clear dark brown w/ a lasting foamy light tan head with good lacing. Aroma was soft but pleasant of plum, chocolate and toffee. Medium body, creamy texture, and soft carbonation. The flavor is malt heavy followed by some sweeter notes of fruit, chocolate and a smokey roasted caramel finish.
Almost black color, looking nice in glass. Some light brown head. Some malts in aroma. Roasty and sweet taste.

50cl bottle @ hotelroom. Clear dark red-brown to dark amber color, small beige head. Smell malts, a bit sweet and slightly raisins. Taste malts, sweetish, raisins and dark fruits. Low body, low carbo.

Pours very dark brown with a large, light tan head.
Nose shows caramel, bready melanoidin malt, toasty and nutty malt and brown sugar.
Flavours almost perfectly mirror the aromas, focussing on sweet bready, toasty, nutty and melanoidin malt. The alcohol is very well-integrated, showing just a little in the finish to balance things out.
Nice creamy body, could use a little more carbonation though.
Very easy to drink!

Caramel, coffee and roasty aroma. Pours dark brown with medium brown head. Tastes malty, light sour and light bitter at the finish. Body is light and texture is slicky. Carbonation is soft. Overall, a good bock but its not my favorite style, although I can say I kinda enjoyed it!

#935
 Dunkelbraun und ziemlich trüb geraten mit bräunlichem Schaum. In der Nase etwas Malzigkeit der herberen Art. Der Antrunk ist dann wiederum nach bayerisch Blockmalz, bitter-süß & etwas brotig gar. Was aber wirklich stört ist diese geradezu bissige Würze im Abgang, die die Zunge belegt und klebrig am Gaumen hängen bleibt. Kann den Referenz-Böcken aus Einbeck und Andechs nicht das Brauwasser reichen!
	
Test vom 11.11.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 8,8,6,6,9,7 - 7,05
Brown color/ tan head. Nice chocolate, nutty, toasted wheat bread, lagered aromas. smooth mouthfeel.
Pours a dark brown, almost black, with a small light tan head, and good lacing.Smell is of malt, caramel, and a tad roastiness.Taste is toasty, oily, malt, syrup, and some nuttiness.  Ends thick.

Bottle. BBE 12.12.12. Pours dark brown, almost black with a large dark latte head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma is strongly of dark, malt bread. Some liquorice and dark fruit in there as well. Taste is sweet, salty liquorice, dark malts, malt bread, some dark fruit as well. Palate is full with just the proper amount of carbonation. An awesome, awesome beer.

Pours a dark Brown with a nice tight finger head that lasted throughout the beer.  Aroma of sweet brown bread, dark fruit, with a hint of nuttiness.  Taste again Caramel malt, rich brown bread, raisins and figs, and the nuttiness at the end. Palate is rich medium to full bodied nicely carbonated creamy and just really nice.

Bottle.Dark Brown colour with medium fluffy head.Aroma is rosted malty with flavor of nuts,rasins and caramel malt,good full body and smooth well balanced taste of dark bread and caramel,really nice beer.

Bottle.  Pours a deep brown color with off white head.  Nutty, toffee, malty aromas.  Caramel, toffee, biscuit, nutty flavors.  One of the best doppelbocks Ive had.  It was a little better when tasted on-tap at the brewery, but its pretty damn good out of the bottle too.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 Pours reddish dark brown with a little little head. Aroma is malty and a bit toasty with notes of caramel and biscuit. Dark fruits are also fairly strongly present - figs, plums, raisins. Hops dont feature much but otherwise a rich taste. Taste is light sweet and toasty; maltiness is prominently present with biscuit, bread and some caramel, though not as much as the aroma suggested. Excellent balance. Palate is medium to full bodied, a bit sticky. Overall, an excellently rich taste for a bottom fermented beer.
Smells like brewing mash. Flavor is heavily roasted malts with a sweet aftertaste. Heavy body.

Bottle from Kaufmarkt, deep browny-red with a fast-settling tan head and a nose of treacle and dried dark fruit. Rich, sweet yet roasty with burnt caramel notes, full-bodied, bitter burnt treacle aftertaste with some grassy hop character and a faint coffee note coming through.

Head: beige colored foam. Color: clear dark copper. Aroma: roasted malt, caramel. Taste: roasted malt, caramel. Palate: full bodied, dry. Overall: nice.
Wow!! Great example of a dunkle-bock!  Terrific!!  Will look for this one again -- for sure!
Heel donkerbruine kleur. Aroma van stroop. Smaakt ook naar stroop  maar is  niet zoet ofzo.  Medium body. Goed te drinken maar niks speciaals.

Black with a red shine. Small head with an almost orange colour. This One doesnt smell really interesting. It reveals its "spirit" when drinking: pleasant sweetness, tasty roastiness, biscuit,.caramel and medium bitterness.

Pitch dark brown body with an off white head. Strong aroma of roasted malts, burned caramel, coffee, some dark chocolate, brown sugar, a hint of grassy hops. Amazing, smooth palate. Great balanced sweet flavour with smooth flavours of coffee, some chocolate, cereal, dark fruits. Awesome.
Bottled. A real good dopple. Nice thick brown piur with Earth tones, caramel and roast.  Some sweet malts in the finish. I enjoyed it.

500 ml bottle from TheEpeeist. Nose is golden raisins, yeast, and bits of toffee with a old ale kind of mustiness. Clear dark brown with a big, heavy lacing beige head. Flavor is toffee, hints of bitterness, banana, and molasses, and a bit of alcohol warmth.
From old backlog. Almost black colour with big beige head. Aroma is malt, sweet, dark fruits. Flavour is roasted, bit fruity. Have to try again.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 Pours beautiful dark bronze, with a generous tan head. Nose is sweet and fruity. Wow! This beer is chock full of flavor. Rich malts and dried fruit flavors. Not much hop noticed here. Very nice!

Pours a deep sensual chocolate brown with thin evanscent head.  Nose marked by raisins and dak rum.  Lively mouthfeel with medium body.  Starts with slight wine and cigar malt moving to a slight tang of currant and finishes with a tootsie roll sweetness and slight alcohol burn.  Nice beer.

Bottle was sitting for a year in my basement so hopefully that has not changed anything too much. Pours a nice dark color with a light tan head into a tulip glass. Nice clean malty aroma with some undertone of fruit and chocolate. Taste is awesomely smooth of fruit, caramel, chocolate and roasted malt. Mouthfeel is a moderate with a clean bitter aftertaste. This is an awesomely smooth beer, I will definitely drink again.
From bottle at SIBF. Hazy red, sour tart malted body. Nice fruity brown, richly fruit, only mild bitter-roast. Fruitier than Id like, tasty.

Reddish pour with a creamy head.  Sugar and licorice aroma.  Some raisin too.  Mouth is big and creamy.  A lot of grain and sugar.  Like a dark piece of bread, pumpernickel maybe.  Nice balance in this one.  Chocolate comes out as it warms up too.

500ml bottle from Spirits Brick. Poured a very nice looking super dark brown almost black body with an average sized thick rich foamy light beige head that leaves gobs of lace all over my Weyerbacher tulip. Aroma was great with loads of dark fruits intertwined with chocolate and a touch of English toffee. Smooth body with average to softer carbonation that comes on towards the end of the swallow and a sweet aftertaste. The flavor is a bit more subdued than the aroma with an initial roastiness followed by some sweeter notes of fruit and chocolate and a slight hint of smoke on the finish. I wasnt expecting much from this but boy was I surprised.

Wow! I expected great things from Weltenburger, and no disappointment here. Pours into glass almost black, like stout. Palate is rich and full,  deep roast grain flavor. This would be more amazing on a cold winters day, but still the best bock Ive had. recommend A+
The head is medium, the body darkred. The taste is very malty, darkmalty, balanced, a bit alcoholic, roasty, smoky. 11/11/11/12/10/12
Bottle.  Pours an amber brown with a white head.  Aroma of ripe fruit, sweet malts and caramel.  Flavour is very sweet with moderate bitterness.  Medium to full bodied with light carbonation.

Backlog 2009, Øl & matfestivalen in Oslo. On bottle.
dark color, some foam.
Medium body & complexity.
Dried fruit aromas, some sweetness.
Ok beer, but not my preferred style

Pour out of 500 mL bottle, dark brownish red pour with off white head, aroma has notes of dark fruits, with raisin, fig, some candied fruits with caramel, toffee, hints of roast and earthy notes, some more spice notes in there with a touch of green apple acidity.  Taste is sweet dark fruits, some caramel, toffee, hints of earth notes, molasses, some spicy yeast, bready notes as well, finishing with some slight bitterness, sweet notes as well.  Tasty.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2013 from bottle. dark amber, hazy colour and a minimal beige head. aromas of chocolate, toffee, roasted malts, dark fruits and liquorice. mighty nuts and chocolate flavours. creamy texture, medium body and average carbonation. long lasting, slightly bitter finish. fantastic beer!

500ml bottle pours brownish amber color with a rich off-white head that retains well and leaves some traces of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is chocolate malts with a hint of roasted barley and earthy hops.  Taste is huge chocolate and caramel malty sweetness with some earthy bitterness coming out in the finish.  Definitely a world class doppelbock and worth a tasting or two.

16.9 oz. bottle, consumed on 6-6-12. Aroma features chocolate, chocolate-chip cookie, black beans, raspberry, cumin, and peach scents. Strong, interesting, enjoyable, spicy smell. Pours dark brown with a large amount of thick, silky, uneven, taupe head. Produces thick lacing. Good-looking beer. Malty, fruity flavor matches the aroma. Milk chocolate, malted milk balls. Sweet but not sugary. Minerally with a dry finish. Reminiscent in flavor of an English ale. Moderate body. Easy to drink. A bit frothy in the palate. Unremarkable palate effects. Highly enjoyable and surprisingly very good overall. I purchased, consumed, and rated this beer ignorant of its high RateBeer score, and I am pleased to see that the RateBeer community agrees with my assessment.
(bottle) deep brown with almost no head. Sweet malt aroma. Flavor of sweet malt, molasses, dark fruits.
Dark brown with medium head. Aroma of raisins, malts and chocolate. Taste malty with some chocolate and slight aftertaste of anise.
500ml bottle.  Pours very dark brown with a large head.  Aroma is thick raisin malt, salty liquorice and a little meaty smoke.  Taste has liquorice, raisin, touches of treacle and meat in the finish.
Pours brownish ruby red with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, toasted caramel, and bready notes. Flavor is toasty caramel, sweet malt, roasted nuts, and earthy notes

Clear, dark brown body with a red tint, topped by a light-brown, creamy head that is short-lived and ends up as a thin film and some residue at the walls. The lightly roasted aroma is faint and not that exciting, although its pleasant enough. Caramel, dark bread and a vinous touch. There are also some almost rotten notes buried deep down in the mix. However, when put where its supposed to be, i.e. in my mouth, this beer is much more interesting! True to the style the taste is moderate to heavy sweet. A moderate to light bitterness makes sure that the beer never feels too cloyingly sweet. Dark, sweet caramel is the backbone of the flavour profile, also toasted notes, dark dried fruits and again this vinous feel. The body is medium to full and the texture is pleasantly oily with a fitting soft carbonation, but an ever-present and annoying metallic feel partially destroys the otherwise pleasant mouthfeel. A decent beer with nice flavours, but a bit uninspiring aroma and too much metal.

[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 3 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

My first Doppelbock! And not the worst buddy!
This pours dark brown, smells Irish stout aromas: chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, smoky. Well balanced, soft bitterness, malty flavours and length.
Very nice beer!

Bottle from State Line Liquor, MD, a very good store.  Deep red brown that is almost opaque with nice last small tan head.  I had this once in Berlin where it seemed more alive and fresh. The overall score at least would be higher.  I also had it found randomly at a Brooklyn supermarket from where it was not this good. Supports that most German beers in the US are a shade of their real potential.  Very nice round sweet malt aroma with a hint of caramel, raisins, dark fruit, cinnamon,  nuts or grains. Flavor is similar, very sweet and slightly cloying.  The texture is silken but ends cleanly other than a little metallic finish.  Cant wait to be back in Germany to re-rate this at 1 euro rather than $5.

500ml. Bottle from the Kumiyama Aeon liquor store. Aromas of deep, dark old-world maltiness, cherries, red berries. Ruby/garnet in the light, thin tan head, moderate lacing. Sweet, slightly phenolic. Long fruity aftertaste, with a coating of coffee at the very end. Medium body, a bit sticky, gentle carbonation. Mild, with just the right amount of alcohol warmth. A very good bock.

A perfect example of the style with malt aroma with figs, caramel, bread and a hint of booze. The pour is dark brown with a slight red hue and a small white head. The flavor follows the aroma with a nice balance of hops. Dont let this one get too cold or you will loose some of the aroma.
Bottle. Color dark brown with medium brownish head. Aroma sweet, caramel, chocolate, dark fruits. Taste sweet, malt, caramel, chocolate, nuts.

Draught at Local Taphouse in Sydney. Pours a dark clear brown with a white head. Smells of caramel, raisin, malt. Tastes of a heavy sweetness, medium-light bitter, some mild fruitiness. Medium bodied, light carbonation, oily texture. Finishes cloyingly sweet, but also with a mild tangy bitterness.
Pours a clean dark brown with a fizzy tan head. The nose and taste are dry, bready, malty. Decent, but not really my cup of tea...

Another bottle brought back from Berlin in April 2011, this half litre one as reviewed on 28th April of that year: only three months before its best before date.

Poured into an Abbot Ale tankard it showed a deep, dark almost black body with a good well built tan coloured head which had a good, lasting retension.

Toasted granary breads, burnt malts and roasted nuts came to me in the smell stakes.

The taste was more coffee and chocolate than the toasted, roasted, burnt aromas I was getting from my nose.

The beer was smooth, warming and rich in wintery chocolate flavours, very drinkable in deed.

Deep cloudy brown, giant dark oatmeal head.
Scent is faint..roasted caramel.
Taste is heavily roasted malt, dark cherry, sweet, raisin, prune.
Almost a little peppery, a hint of chocolate.
Very Good.
Dark brown with disappearing brown head. Not much on the aroma side. Very similar to Celebrator but not as harsh. Enjoyable.
Bottle 50 cl. Deep red with a nice head. Aroma of roasted malt and dark fruites. Bitter - sweet taste with a roasted ending.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Vika. Pours clear dark reddish brown with a small tan head. Aroma of dried fruits, malt, caramel with chocolate and some roastiness. Taste is sweet, fruity and malty with raisins and some chocolate and caramel. A bit too sweet for me, but there is some dryish bitterness in the finish. Quite well balanced and tasty. Nice winter warmer, would work well as a Christmas beer.

Mahogany, amber when backlit, thin tan head.  Aroma is sweet honey suckle and grass, light caramel and lager aroma.  Flavor is fin the line of the Korbinian- huge refreshing sweetness, a little less malt bite, but a bit more lager-yeast character, especially as it warms.  Delicious, honey, malt, clean light resinous bitterness.  Delicious!

Pours dark brown/mahogany with a thing beige head. Aroma of toffee, dark fruit, some roast malt, crackery. Taste is sweet with lots of dark fruit and toffee. Thick texture, with medium high but not abrasive carbonation. Very nice beer.

50 cl bottle.
Pours clear red-brown color with large foamy head. Aroma of sweet caramel malts, ripe fruits, mild wooden notes and some berries on the background. Sweet palate with a sweet long aftertaste.
5325

0,5l from Sörspecialista, Budapest. Beautiful clear ruby color with big frothy off-white head, which disappears quickly. Intensive but smooth odor, caramel, roasty, a bit cheesy and buttery. Alcohol, caramel, roasty, buttery aroma. More pleasent than other bocks. Surprisingly dry taste, the bocks are usually sweeter. Full body with creamy oily texture and average carbonation. It caresses the tongue... Sweet but roasty, creamy, cheesy finish. After drinking the glass smells like the barley malt before mashing. Very complex one. Smoother and more sophisticated than other bocks.

Bottle fro Alko Äbo cons 2012-02-11 Göteborg
AR: roasted malt, baking syrup. bread
AP: ruby colored body, wee thin bone white deminishing head
F: full bodied, caramel, syrup, sticky, medium bitterness, medium carbonation, wee warming feeling

Date: January 24, 2012 Mode: Bottle Source: BVery via BlueMax Description: Dark brown pour with large amount of head and nice spotty lacing.  Aroma is nutty, malty, caramel and chocolate.  Taste is consistent with aroma, creamy, medium bodied, just delicious.

Bottle. Dark chestnut pour with a monster foamy white head with great lacing. Smells exactly like a brewery - mash and malt. Caramel, nutty, chocolate. Full creamy palate. Great taste of caramel, earth, malt. Beautiful beer.

coffee, resin, nuts, herbs, basement aromas, leather, cooked vegetables, smoke, skunky, butterscotch, woody, golden, clear, head, sparkling, rocky head, brown foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, umami, bitter, long finish, flat, creamy, oily feel, full body,
Clear dark reddish brown with a huge and lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. Smooth and soft. Full bodied. 200112
Bottle. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is malt, chocolate and caramel. Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit, nutty, little toffee, little chocolate, medium sweet, hops and medium bitter.

Bottle. Deep, clear copper body with garnet highlights. Frothy, off-white head. Big, rich malty aroma and not much else. Toasted grain and sweet caramel. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes moderately sweet and lightly bitter. Medium to full body, creamy texture, moderate carbonation. Just like the aroma, it tastes of rich malts, but its far from cloying. Theres a hint of licorice taste. Delicious.
Aroma of dark fruits and a hint of clove.  Pours brown with a decent head.  Tastes like a perfect doppelbock.  Dark fruits, clove and just a little bit of roasted malt.  Pleasant.

Thanks to Ernesto987 who sent this for SS.
I got this in Secret Santa and I must have put this on my wants list years ago. Now I know why I did.
Gorgeous clear dark brown body with a generous dark tan head that held well.
Rich malt aroma, sweet dark caramel, some fruits, not quite licorice but something that heads that way too.
The flavor is full on malt as a good Doppelbock should be.  Just delicious.  Couldnt be smoother or better balanced.
Ill have to remember to seek out more of this.  Excellent example of a style that I like and havent had much of recently.  Great to have and at a perfect time of year - this spring beer can jump into the rotation as soon as the weather cools in my opinion.
Recommended for anyone who "doesnt like dark beers" or who doesnt like beer because it is "too bitter".
Bottle. Aroma sweet malts. Tastes malts. An absolute must for anyone that likes malty beers. This has it all in a perfectly balanced set. Not Bad.

Complex, rich, wide-shouldered and delicious. When youve had one of these you know youve had a beer. This is one of those few beers after which you just sit and smile because whatever else happens, today was a good day. Not quite at the Trappist Rochefort level, but close.
on tap-pours a retaining light tan head with hazy amber color.  Aroma is sweet medium malt-caramel/roasty.  Taste is sweet medium malt-caramel/roasty, hint of spice hops.

Bottle from brewery. Dark brown, almost black color with medium beige head. Aroma of prunes, honey, caramel,spices. Taste, dried plums, raisins, coffee, honey, caramel, rum. Alcohol is strongly present. Nice.

Chevy Chase, DC 500ml ($4.50): Pours really dark for a doppelbock with a prodigious beige head. Aroma is fruit and chocolate and a hint of liqueur. Body is flawless. Balance is flawless. Taste is all chocolatey and tolerably sweet. Fruitiness come from another side and makes me a happy camper. Roasted malts in a subdued, but critical role. Beer at its best. Really. I was expecting this to be a good, but it was better than that. As someone else noted, you could drink this all day, you could also sip it and enjoy it about as much.

Bottle from Sams Quik Shop in Durham. Pouts deep chestnut with thin beige head with yellowish tint. Nose of burnt sugar, caramel, toffee, molasses. Some cake and dark fruits. Smells super sweet, but the taste is more complex and delicate, and the lower abv serves it well. Lighter palate, too. Nice one.

Bottle: &nbsp Burnt caramel, moderate to thin frothy off-white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Bready and biscuity 

on the nose, somewhat sweet. &nbsp Not heavy or big on the dark pitted fruit like so many other examples. &nbsp Bready 

with a good does of fruitiness on the tongue. &nbsp Really smooth. &nbsp I sat on this bottle for a few years, date on 

it is 3/18/09. &nbsp Still tastes fine, and in some cases perhaps a little milder. &nbsp This one certainly isnt as 

heavy or pungent or overpowering with dark pitted fruit. &nbsp Its much lighter, yet stronger than your average bock. 

&nbsp I can see why this is popular. &nbsp Malty, soft sweetness, with a little bit of fruity and bready character. 

&nbsp Probably one of the only Doppelbocks I could drink all day. &nbsp Good stuff!

500ml bottle. Poured a clear but deep mahogany with an initially large though gradually disappearing beige to light tan head. Rich, sweet, big malt aromas. Demerara sugar, molasses, cakey toffee, dried fruits and light hints of roast & virginia tobacco. Again, rich & malty sweet on the tongue with a dryer, more prominent roast edge. More demerara sugar, toffee, cake and molasses all rounded by a dark malty bitterness. A lingering tangy fruit aftertaste finishes off each sip. Medium body, medium, drying carbonation, lingering bittersweet malts. A rounded, firm & supple malt showcase yet clean & crisp in the traditional style despite the big malt sweetness.
